intro: Duravia bidwelliae, commonly known as Bidwell's duravia, is a rare flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in open woodland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
